results.title: Hit and Miss/One Voice
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel, Stephen Ramsey, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Hit and Miss” we meet Adam, dealing with the pressures of school and family. The resulting conflict is resolved in a constructive way. A teenager who decides to take part in an anti-logging protest is featured in “One Voice” Amber is ostracised by her peers, but supported by her parents. Watch her confidence increase as she pursues her beliefs undeterred by the attitudes of her peers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pip Karmel, Stephen Ramsey, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders

results.title: Hit and miss
results.brief_description: Presents nine vignettes about conflict between young people and their parents. Each situation tends to be sympathetic to young people. Focuses on typically Anglo-saxon family situations.

results.title: History on the run: the media and the '79 election
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Raymont and Simon Riley
results.brief_description: History on the Run examines the media’s coverage of Canada’s federal election of May, 1979. Spanning a three-week period, it is literally filmed “on the run.” A fascinating look at journalists in action, it is also an opportunity to glimpse political figures behind the scenes and their attempts to manipulate the media.
results.title_for_label: History on the run: the media and the ‘79 election
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Peter Raymont and Simon Riley
